title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 173.1 - Nonfee duplicates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 173.1 - Nonfee duplicates

State Regulations
(a) As permitted by chapter 548 of the Laws
of 1986, whenever a driver's license, learner's permit, registration
certificate or number plate or plates has or have been destroyed, stolen or
lost as a result of a crime, the victim of such crime may apply to the

Department of Motor Vehicles and be issued such lost, stolen or destroyed item
or items without payment of any fee, provided that at the time of application
he or she submits a letter or report from a police agency substantially as set
forth in subdivision (b) of this section confirming that the applicant has
reported the crime and the loss of such item or items to that police
agency. (b) Suggested form letter
is set forth below: Police Letterhead
(VIN).............................................................................................. DATE.. SIGNATURE......................................................................................... BADGE NUMBER AND RANK
Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
173.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
